page.title: 01Stratford-upon-Avon N.W.
page.content: The{Landscape}is one of low undulating hills to the N.W. of the town of{Stratford-upon-Avon. The land use includes enclosed rough grazing,grassland,cultivated fields, woodland,and residential and commercial areas.There are three major {farms}in the area which specialise in Hereford beef cattle,race horses,and mixed farming respectively. Stratford is a centre of{tourism and our survey includes accounts of the Welcombe and Moat House hotels,as well as Shakespeare's Birthplace.The residential areas cover a range of styles from Victorian terraces to large mansions,and include a maternity hospital,the headquarters of the N.F.U.,a leisure centre,a variety of shops,and two old people's homes.
